Screen.title: TopScreen
Screen.Label: ---------- Mouse Button 1 click on field to change ----------

Help.Tip: Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
Help.Text:
off2ang - PROCESSDEFAULTS
Menu allowing user choice of stored parameter defaults.
 
 Default = SYSTEM
 Allowed = SYSTEM
 Allowed = PROJECT
 Allowed = USER
 SYSTEM defaults are the defaults listed in the CPS documentation.
 
 PROJECT defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as Project
 Default button.
 
 USER defaults are defaults the user has saved via the Save as User Default
 button.

Screen.title: off2ang
Screen.Label: Offset to angle or angle to offset transforms.
DEP_SCALE=
OPT_DIR =
SYM_OFF=
OFF_FFT =
DEP_FFT =
OFF_TOT =
ANG_TOT =
OFF_INIT =
ANG_INIT =
OFF_LAST =
ANG_LAST =
OFF_INC =
ANG_INC =

Help.Tip: Scale factor for intput vertical units.
Help.Text:
off2ang - DEP_SCALE
Scale factor for intput vertical units.
 
 Default = 1000.
 Allowed = real>0.
 The input time orign and increment are assumed to depth divided by DEP_SCALE.

Help.Tip: Type of transform.
Help.Text:
off2ang - OPT_DIR
Type of transform.
 
 Default = OFFSET_TO_ANGLE
 Allowed = OFFSET_TO_ANGLE - offset to angle  transform.
 Allowed = ANGLE_TO_OFFSET - angle  to offset transform.

Help.Tip: Use symetric offset during the fft.
Help.Text:
off2ang - SYM_OFF
Use symetric offset during the fft.
 
 Default = YES
 Allowed = YES
 Allowed = NO

Help.Tip: Number of offset fft trace bins.
Help.Text:
off2ang - OFF_FFT
Number of offset fft trace bins.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0
 The number of offset fft trace bins.

Help.Tip: Number of depth fft trace bins.
Help.Text:
off2ang - DEP_FFT
Number of depth fft trace bins.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0
 The number of depth fft trace bins.

Help.Tip: Number of offset trace bins.
Help.Text:
off2ang - OFF_TOT
Number of offset trace bins.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0
 The number of offset trace bins.

Help.Tip: Number of angle trace bins.
Help.Text:
off2ang - ANG_TOT
Number of angle trace bins.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = int>0
 The number of angle trace bins.

Help.Tip: First offset image location to migrate data to.
Help.Text:
off2ang - OFF_INIT
First offset image location to migrate data to.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: First angle bin midpoint value in degrees.
Help.Text:
off2ang - ANG_INIT
First angle bin midpoint value in degrees.
 
 Default = 0
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Last offset trace bin location.
Help.Text:
off2ang - OFF_LAST
Last offset trace bin location.
 
 Default = 100
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Last angle bin midpoint in degrees.
Help.Text:
off2ang - ANG_LAST
Last angle bin midpoint in degrees.
 
 Default = 80.
 Allowed = 0.<=real<=90.

Help.Tip: FFT trace bin spacing.
Help.Text:
off2ang - OFF_INC
FFT trace bin spacing.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = real

Help.Tip: Angle bin spacing in degrees.
Help.Text:
off2ang - ANG_INC
Angle bin spacing in degrees.
 
 Default = 1
 Allowed = real>=0.

Help.Tip: Button that removes this process parameter screen.
Help.Text:
off2ang - CLOSE
Button that removes this process parameter screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Appears only on the view-only process parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
Help.Text:
off2ang - OK
Button to accept parameter values, run traps and remove screen.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values, runs the parameter traps and removes
 the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
Help.Text:
off2ang - APPLY
Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that accepts parameter values and runs the parameter traps but does
 not remove the parameter screen.

Help.Tip: Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
Help.Text:
off2ang - CANCEL
Button to remove the parameter screen without changing parameters.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =

Help.Tip: Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
Help.Text:
off2ang - RESET
Set parameters to their initial value or last applied value.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that sets the parameters back to their values when the screen appeared
 or to their last applied value.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
Help.Text:
off2ang - PROCESSLISTLEFT
Accept the current parameters and move to the previous process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the previous process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
Help.Text:
off2ang - PROCESSLIST
Menu of processes in the current workfile and their number.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Menu that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to any chosen process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
Help.Text:
off2ang - PROCESSLISTRIGHT
Accept the current parameters and move to the next process.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that allows the user to accept the current parameter values, run the
 parameter traps and move to the next process in the current workfile.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
Help.Text:
off2ang - PROJECTDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as Project Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as Project Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of Project Defaults for a project.

Help.Tip: Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
Help.Text:
off2ang - USERDEFAULT
Save the current parameter values as User Defaults.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 Button that saves the current parameter values as User Defaults for this
 process.  There will be one set of User Defaults for a userid.

Help.Tip: Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
Help.Text:
off2ang - HELP
Allows the user to access the pop-up Help Window.
 
 Default =
 Allowed =
 The Help Window allows access to three kinds of help:  Parameter Help, CPS
 Process Help and Application (CFE) Help.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                         C P S   P R O C E S S
 
 Name       : off2ang
 Category   : Transforms
 Written    : 2001-08-22   by: Douglas Hanson
 Revised    : 2006-10-16   by: D. Glover
 Maturity   : production
 Purpose    : Transform from offset depth to offset angle or reverse.
 Portability: No known limitations.
 Parallel   : No
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          GENERAL DESCRIPTION
 
  Transform a Common Image Point Gather (CIG) from offset to angle
  or from angle to offset in the depth wavenumber - offset wavenumber domain
 
  Equation 20 page 7.
  tan ( incidence angle ) = - offset wavenumber / vertical wavenumber
 
  Amplitude-preserved wave-equation migration.
  Paul Sava abd Biondo Biondi
  Stanford Exploration Project Report SEP-108, April 2, 2001 pages 1-27
 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                          ADVICE FOR USERS
 
                        INPUT PARAMETERS
 
 Name  Default  Valid    Description
 ----  -------  -----    -----------
 
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
 This process is re-enterable.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                           REVISION HISTORY
 
     Date        Author         Description
     ----        ------         -----------
007. 2006-10-16 D. Glover       Added NULLIFY statements for Intel compiler.
  6. 2006-01-10 B. Menger       Removed Unused Variables.
  5  2005-08-18 Douglas Hanson  Fix negative offsets in fft.
  4  2005-05-24 Douglas Hanson  Add sym_off
  3  2001-10-26 Karen Goodger   Rename labels that begin with if to get around
                                intel compiler bug.
  2  2001-09-04 Douglas Hanson  Fix OPT_DIR error.
  1  2001-08-22 Douglas Hanson  Original version.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
